body_html:
@sarkistlt Unfortunately no, we are NOT talking of doing a javascript implementation of Tensorflow, which keras.js does, but we are talking having a nodejs wrapper around the C++ api of Tensorflow, so it requires understanding how to write native add-ons for NodeJs.
Other useful source.
Unfortunately my day job is not coding and it requires proficiency in C++, which I personally don't have.

By the way keras.js does only inference, no training, so no backpropagation.
Google developers implemented a small portion of Tensorflow in Javascript in their playground, the neural network implementation is here and does include back propagation.

body:
@sarkistlt Unfortunately no, we are NOT talking of doing a javascript implementation of Tensorflow, which `keras.js` does, but we are talking having a nodejs **wrapper** around the C++ api of Tensorflow, so it requires understanding how to [write native add-ons for NodeJs](https://blog.risingstack.com/writing-native-node-js-modules/).
Other useful [source](https://github.com/freezer333/nodecpp-demo).
Unfortunately my day job is not coding and it requires proficiency in C++, which I personally don't have.

By the way `keras.js` does only inference, no training, so no backpropagation.
Google developers implemented a small portion of Tensorflow in Javascript in their [playground](https://github.com/tensorflow/playground), the neural network implementation is [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/playground/blob/master/src/nn.ts) and does include [back propagation](https://github.com/tensorflow/playground/blob/master/src/nn.ts#L282).
